title: Ticket #6106: bosco installation doesn't support slurm
description:
Hi,

Installing the latest bosco version 1.2.6 from

ftp://ftp.cs.wisc.edu/condor/bosco/1.2.6/

doesn't work with a remote slurm site. If I follow the instructions on

http://www.t2.ucsd.edu/twiki2/bin/view/UCSDTier2/BoscoSDSC

it doesn't accept slurm as a valid choice for remote batch system. If I try to use the bosco_quickstart install method, it accepts slurm but maps it automatically to pbs.

Install method from the BoscoSDSC twiki actually works if I change

bin/bosco_cluster

slightly and add slurm to the list of allowed options (line 793). Installation works and the following

bosco_cluster --add hufnagel@cori.nersc.gov slurm

also works. A subsequent

bosco_cluster --test hufnagel@cori.nersc.gov slurm

does not work though. It doesn't like the slurm line in the configuration, even though a factory with the same setup can submit just fine to the same remote slurm batch system using the new installation.

Cheers

Dirk
remarks:
2017-Jan-24 14:09:44 by jfrey:
Can you be more specific about what's failing after you modify bosco_cluster?

I am able to configure a slurm cluster and run jobs there after tweaking bosco_cluster.

2017-Jan-25 17:53:27 by hufnagel: 
bash-4.1$ source ~/bosco/bosco_setenv
bash-4.1$ bosco_start
BOSCO Started
bash-4.1$ bosco_cluster --test hufnagel@cori.nersc.gov
<bunch of output from the ssh session>
Passed!
Testing bosco submission...Failed
ERROR: Parse error in expression: grid_resource = batch slurm hufnagel@cori.nersc.gov Error in config file SUBMIT_ATTRS or SUBMIT_EXPRS value. Aborting submit.

2017-Feb-07 15:49:07 by jfrey:
The bug here is that BOSCO's trick to make the grid_resource attribute optional in the submit file stopped working in HTCondor 8.4.7 (due to #5694). It's unrelated to slurm. To work around this failure, you need to remove the SUBMIT_EXPRS line in ~/bosco/local.bosco/config/condor_config.bosco_routing.

I'll change bosco_cluster to not set this config parameter.

2017-Feb-27 16:41:28 by tim:
CODE REVIEW: Looks good
